com.karmant.syn

Class TokenDescriptor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.karmant.syn.TokenDescriptor

  • public class TokenDescriptor
extends java.lang.Object
    Token descriptor. Exists for every terminal symbol used in a grammar. For each literal terminal symbol (e. g. ID) there is a unique global token descriptor accessible via the corresponding public static field (e. g. ID). Token descriptors for custom terminals (keywords, key-characters) are created when a SynParser instance is created.

    • Field Detail

      • END_OF_FILE

        public static final TokenDescriptor END_OF_FILE
        End-of-file token descriptor. Used internally by the parser, but not included into the generated Abstract Syntax Tree which is returned to the client code.

      • ID

        public static final TokenDescriptor ID
        Identifier token descriptor.

      • INTEGER

        public static final TokenDescriptor INTEGER
        Integer literal token descriptor.

      • FLOAT

        public static final TokenDescriptor FLOAT
        Floating-point literal token descriptor.

      • STRING

        public static final TokenDescriptor STRING
        String literal token descriptor.

    • Method Detail

      • getType

        public TokenType getType()
        Returns the token type of this token descriptor.
        Returns:
        the token type. Cannot be null.

      • getLiteral

        public java.lang.String getLiteral()
        Returns the literal of this token descriptor. Literal terminal symbols do not have literals, in that case the method returns null. For custom terminal symbols (keywords and key-characters), the literal is not null.
        Returns:
        the literal.

      • forType

        public static TokenDescriptor forType(TokenType tokenType)
        Returns a token descriptor for the passed token type. The type must describe a literal token (see TokenType). The method always returns the same instance of a token descriptor for the same token type.
        Parameters:
        tokenType - the token type.
        Returns:
        the token descriptor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the passed token type is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the passed token type does not denote a literal token.

      • forLiteral

        public static TokenDescriptor forLiteral(java.lang.String literal)
        Returns a new token descriptor for a custom terminal symbol with the specified literal.
        Parameters:
        literal - the terminal symbol literal. Cannot be null. Must be either an identifier, or a key-character, but not mixed.
        Returns:
        a new token descriptor instance for the passed literal.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the passed literal is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the passed literal is not a valid literal.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Different instances with equal types and literals are considered equal.
